# About

Dwarftype is a minimalistic and customizable [typing test](https://dwarfknighttechnologies.com/). It features many test modes, an account system to save your typing speed history, and user-configurable features such as themes, sounds, a smooth caret, and more. Dwarftype attempts to emulate a natural typing experience during a typing test by unobtrusively presenting the text prompts and displaying typed characters in place, providing straightforward, real-time feedback on typos, speed, and accuracy.

# Features

-   minimalistic design, with optional advertisements and focus mode while typing
-   type what you see, see what you type
-   live errors, wpm, and accuracy displays
-   a variety of test lengths and languages
-   punctuation and numbers modes
-   quotes
-   themes
-   smooth caret
-   account system
-   challenges and just-for-fun test modifiers
-   and much more

# Discord bot

On the [Monkeytype Discord server](https://www.discord.gg/monkeytype), we added a Discord bot to auto-assign optional roles based on typing performance and challenge completion. You can find its code over at https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype-bot.

# Bug report or Feature request

If you encounter a bug or have a feature request, [send us an email](mailto:contact@monkeytype.com), [create an issue](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/issues), [create a discussion thread](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/discussions), or [join the Discord server](https://www.discord.gg/monkeytype).

# Want to Contribute?

Refer to [CONTRIBUTING.md](./docs/CONTRIBUTING.md).

# Code of Conduct

Before contributing to this repository, please read the [code of conduct](./docs/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md).

# Security

To report a security vulnerability, please refer to [SECURITY.md](./docs/SECURITY.md).

# Credits

[Montydrei](https://www.reddit.com/user/montydrei) for the name suggestion.

Everyone who provided valuable feedback on the [original Reddit post](https://www.reddit.com/r/MechanicalKeyboards/comments/gc6wx3/experimenting_with_a_completely_new_type_of/) for the prototype of this website.

All of the [contributors](https://github.com/monkeytypegame/monkeytype/graphs/contributors) have helped implement various features, add themes, fix bugs, and more.

# Support

If you wish to support further development and feel extra awesome, you can [donate](https://ko-fi.com/monkeytype), [become a Patron](https://www.patreon.com/monkeytype) or [buy a t-shirt](https://www.monkeytype.store/).

1. Monokai
   Description: A classic dark theme with vibrant colors, originally from Sublime Text.
   Features: High contrast with a strong emphasis on readability.
   Popular In: Sublime Text, Visual Studio Code, Atom.
2. Solarized Dark/Light
   Description: A balanced color scheme designed for both light and dark backgrounds, focusing on reducing eye strain.
   Features: Low contrast, 16 colors designed to work well in both modes.
   Popular In: Vim, Emacs, IntelliJ IDEA.
3. Dracula
   Description: A dark theme with pastel colors, optimized for eye comfort.
   Features: Consistent coloring across different editors.
   Popular In: Visual Studio Code, Atom, Sublime Text.
4. Gruvbox
   Description: A retro groove color scheme for Vim with both dark and light versions.
   Features: Medium contrast with a focus on readability and colors that are easy on the eyes.
   Popular In: Vim, Visual Studio Code.
5. One Dark Pro
   Description: A theme inspired by Atom's One Dark theme.
   Features: Dark background with bright foreground colors for clear distinction.
   Popular In: Visual Studio Code.
6. Tomorrow Night
   Description: A family of themes with light and dark variants.
   Features: Simple and clean design with subtle color variations.
   Popular In: Sublime Text, Visual Studio Code.
7. Nord
   Description: An arctic, north-bluish color palette, designed for use with a range of applications.
   Features: Calm and soothing colors with a focus on balance.
   Popular In: Visual Studio Code, Vim, Atom.
8. Material Theme
   Description: A set of themes inspired by Googleâ€™s Material Design.
   Features: Clean lines and intuitive design, with various color combinations.
   Popular In: IntelliJ IDEA, Visual Studio Code.
9. Gruvbox Material
   Description: An adaptation of Gruvbox with better contrast and a more modern look.
   Features: Enhanced color palette for better readability.
   Popular In: Neovim, Visual Studio Code.
10. Palenight
    Description: A Material-inspired theme with a soft palette.
    Features: Pastel colors with a comfortable contrast ratio.
    Popular In: Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text.
11. Cobalt2
    Description: A bright, bold theme that focuses on contrast.
    Features: High contrast with rich blues and oranges.
    Popular In: Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text.
12. Ayu
    Description: A simple theme with warm colors, available in light, dark, and mirage versions.
    Features: Pastel tones with a focus on comfort during long coding sessions.
    Popular In: Visual Studio Code, Sublime Text.
13. Night Owl
    Description: A theme optimized for people working late at night.
    Features: Muted blues with accent colors for clarity.
    Popular In: Visual Studio Code.
14. Tokyo Night
    Description: A dark theme with a Tokyo city nightlife aesthetic.
    Features: High contrast with a mix of neon-inspired colors.
    Popular In: Neovim, Visual Studio Code.
15. SynthWave '84
    Description: A theme with a retro-futuristic look inspired by the synthwave music genre.
    Features: Neon colors and vibrant design.
    Popular In: Visual Studio Code.
